sen.j: 建暦2年（1212年）1月、征夷大将軍源実朝の面前における弓始めの儀で射手の一番手として召されるが当日弓を帯びておらず、与えられた荒木の弓を用いてその剛力と優れた弓術を見せた。
sen.e: In January, 1212, he was selected as the first archer in yumi-hajime (Honorable First Bow) in front of Seii Taishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians, great, unifying leader) MINAMOTO no Sanetomo, but did not have a bow and borrowed a bow of Araki and showed his strength and the art of Japanese archery and he was given jito-shiki (stewardship rights) as an Imperial gift by Sanetomo who was impressed by him ("Azuma Kagami" article dated January 11 in the same year).

In January, 1212, he was selected as the first archer in yumi-hajime (Honorable First Bow) in front of Seii Taishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians, great, unifying leader) MINAMOTO no Sanetomo, but did not have a bow and borrowed a bow of Araki and showed his strength and an excellent art of Japanese archery, for that he was given jito-shiki (stewardship rights) as an Imperial gift by Sanetomo who was impressed by him ("Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East) article dated January 11 in the same year).
sen.cmt: 「優れた弓術」とあるのでan excellent art of archeryと変更しました。Andが続いてしまうので、最後のものを, for that と変更しました。吾妻鏡の補足が入っていませんでした。
sen.e: In the first month of 1212, he was chosen to be the first archer in the yumi-hajime (an archery ceremony) in front of the Shogun MINAMOTO no Sanetomo, but had not brought a bow, so he took up the rough wooden bow he was given and displayed his great strength as well as his surpassing skill in archery.

sen.j: そのことから、感心した実朝によって越前国稲津保の地頭職を下賜された（『吾妻鏡』同年1月11日 (旧暦)条）。
sen.e: As a result, Sanetomo, who was impressed with his archery display, granted him jito-shiki (stewardship rights) to Inazuho in Echizen Province (according to the entry in the "Azuma kagami" for the eleventh day of the first month of the same year).

sen.e: He joined the army of Tomotoki HOJO that advanced along the Hokuriku-do Road on the Shogunate side in the Jokyu war (article dated June 8, 1221, in "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East)).
